content.description:
Go up good holds to a lip. Above the lip is a hollow flake you pull on to reach either deep loose fingers right or a thin shallow crack (too shallow for my large fingers) above the hollow flake. This gets your fingers onto the broken out pancake flake which you work to get to another circular broken out pancake. Use this with no feet to get to a deep hand to arm jam for a rest in the gash in the wall. From here head right up a flake seam to the top.

Pat yourself on the back.

Can easily cheat using the offwidth corner to bypass some moves if you get stuck
content.protection: Six Bolts to chain anchor. Can set up anchor on top rope easily from Space Cadet.
content.location: Bolt line on the beautiful orange dihedral

content.description: Fantastic arete up plates and knobs.
content.protection: 4 bolts optional knob sling. Ends in chain anchor.

climbs.name: Parkour
climbs.fa: Jeremy Ross, Justin Ross, Cori Sutherland, Grame Doe, Tom Slater

content.description:
Route climbs the left leaning crack to anchor.

Details:

Scramble up to the left-leaning crack on Upper Wall Left and side pull up to a hand crack.

Jam fist to hands until you get on top of the flake in the triangle. The transition to knobs and crack combo. Knobs were much nicer as the mossy crack becomes wide hands to fist.

When it gets easy, look right for the chain anchors on the right shared with all the routes in this area. Not much reason to continue up the easy stuff from here so rap down.
content.location: Start of obvious left leaning crack in Upper Wall Left. Tunnel through the boulders straight back from the base of crack to get to start.

climbs.name: Option Paralysis
climbs.fa: Jeremy and Justin Ross, C Sutherland, Grahm Doe, T Slater

content.description: The name says it all - you have three options for the start of this fun route - do all three! The right-hand most start uses the prominent slanting crack which goes from right to left across the cliff face.  The middle option goes straight up the face (past two bolts).  The left hand option uses a crack to the left of the bolted face.  All three options intersect at the diagonal just below a triangular slot.  From this intersection, head up and right following the big features and then cut left to the anchors, again following the big features.  Basically what you are doing is making a detour around the blank face that is directly below the anchors
content.protection: Light rack of gear to 3", slings for plates, a few draws.
content.location: This route starts to the left of the previous route, Booster Rocket, and shares an anchor with that route.

climbs.name: Last Chance to Dance Trance
climbs.fa: Jeremy Ross, Justin Ross, Cori Sutherland 2005

content.description: Climb the stack and then teeter on a reach to climb first bolt. Climb the runnel, mostly staying on the right side. I did a combination side pull counter pressure technique to keep the left foot strong while inching up. Many small depressions for feet. Finish on a 5.fun ladder of knobs.
content.protection: 3 bolts, one optional cam placement, 1-2 chicken heads. Rings on bolted anchor.
content.location: From High Eagle Upper, tunnel through boulders to reach the base of a dark runnel to the right of a boulder stack.

content.description: Starts in a crack (no gear needed) and continues straight up the face. Skirts the left edge of the frowning mouth.
content.location: This route is located on the Upper Wall Left section of Eagle's nest. It is the second route you come to as you access the wall, which is approached from above. This route shares anchors with Dark Matter and Space Cadet, so it can be toproped if you lead one of the easier routes.

This route is located on the Upper Wall Left section of Eagle's nest.  It is the first route you come to as you access the wall, which is approached from above.  This route shares anchors with Deep Space and Space Cadet, so it can be toproped if you lead one of the easier routes.

content.description: Fun short route with a little crack, a little face.  This route starts to the left of the prominent diagonal,  in either of the cracks which form an inverted V shape (both equally nice).  At the top of the V, head up the face, passing a bolt.  Keep up the plates until you intersect the large diagonal crack, cross over it and head right to the anchors.
content.protection: Small rack of gear to 3" for the initial crack section. Long runners to sling the plates. 1 bolt in the face. Ends at bolt anchor.
content.location:
This route is located on the Upper Wall Left section of Eagle's Nest. As you look at the wall, you will see that it is split by a very prominent right to left crack from bottom to the top. This route starts to the left of the diagonal in either of the cracks which form an inverted V.

Get to base of climb by tunneling through brush via the left.
